actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to Subcommittee on Military Personnel and Compensation.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Military Personnel and Compensation

official_title: A bill to amend section 709 of title 32, United States Code, to eliminate the requirement that 30 days notice of termination of employment be given to civilian National Guard technicians who serve under temporary appointments, who are serving during a trial or probationary period, or who voluntarily cease to be members of the National Guard.

summary.text: Eliminates the requirement that 30 days termination notice be given to a civilian National Guard technician if such technician is a temporary or probationary employee or if such technician is a member of the Guard as a condition of employment and voluntarily terminates his membership.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 709 of title 32, United States Code, to eliminate the requirement that 30 days notice of termination of employment be given to civilian National Guard technicians who serve under temporary appointments, who are serving during a trial or probationary period, or who voluntarily cease to be members of the National Guard.
